channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Asia-Pacific markets mostly fall, but China set to rebound from near six-year low
item.description: Investors will react to August inflation figures out from India, which showed the consumer price index rose 3.65% year on year, rising from a five-year low.

item.title: China's plan to boost consumption by encouraging trade-ins has yet to show results
item.description: Several major cities and provinces have only in the last few weeks announced details on how the trade-in program would work for residents.

item.title: Federal Reserve will opt for slow policy easing as there's 'still work to do' on inflation, Fitch says
item.description: Fitch also gave some predictions on Asian central banks, such as the People's Bank of China and the Bank of Japan

item.title: Harris or Trump: Does it matter for China who wins the election?
item.description: The U.S. in May announced stiff duties on about $18 billion worth of Chinese imports, including EVs, solar cells, lithium batteries, steel and aluminum.

item.title: People love traveling, but dislike planning. Hear how Booking Holdings CEO plans to change that
item.description: Rather than travelers planning a trip from scratch, companies will know "everything" about the traveler from the start, said Booking Holdings CEO Glenn Fogel.

item.title: Adobe stock slips on soft fourth-quarter revenue guidance
item.description: Adobe reported third-quarter results on Thursday that beat Wall Street expectations for sales and earnings.

item.title: Asian chip-related stocks rally on renewed AI optimism after Nvidia CEO comments
item.description: Asian chipmaking heavyweights extended Wall Street's rally as Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang made bullish comments about the AI darling's outlook.

item.title: This 32-year-old cashed out on over $2 million in startup equity—here are five tips on how to negotiate for more shares
item.description: Bhavik Vashi, 32, made over $2 million after selling his equity in software startup Anaplan. He gives four tips on how to be best positioned for a negotiation.

item.title: Dutch neobank Bunq goes on hiring spree, targeting digital nomads, as other fintechs slash jobs
item.description: Bunq, the Dutch digital bank, told CNBC it plans to increase its global headcount by over 70% in 2024.

item.title: Bill Gates shares the single-minded attitude he used to grow Microsoft: I focused my life 'just on the one job'
item.description: When Bill Gates co-founded Microsoft at age 20, he wasn't thinking about becoming a billionaire. Here's the one thing he single-mindedly focused on, instead.

item.title: UniCredit's Andrea Orcel plays a bold hand, with Commerzbank in his sights
item.description: Speculation is rife over whether UniCredit's surprise stake build in Commerzbank will lead to a takeover bid of the German lender.

item.title: Microsoft to cut 650 jobs at its Xbox gaming unit — read the full memo from top exec Phil Spencer
item.description: Microsoft said Thursday that it is cutting 650 roles at its Xbox gaming division, in the latest major round of layoffs to hit the video game industry.

item.title: Intel getting help from Commerce Secretary Raimondo as part of effort to spur U.S. production
item.description: Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo has met with investors recently to tout the benefits of Intel and U.S. chip production.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: What happens when the Fed cuts rates?
item.description: Inside India also has more on whether Gautam Adani, founder of the Adani Group conglomerate, could become a trillionaire.

item.title: Russia turns the tables on Ukraine, launching counterattacks to retake Kursk after incursion stalls
item.description: Russia appears to have launched a major counteroffensive to retake areas of its Kursk border region that were seized by Ukrainian forces in a bold incursion.

item.title: Harris raises $47 million in 24 hours after Trump debate
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris raised $47 million from 600,000 donors in the first full day after her commanding debate performance against Donald Trump.

item.title: JD Vance repeats inflated immigration figures rejected by experts
item.description: Donald Trump's running mate, JD Vance, made the claim on CNBC while speaking against the notion that increased immigration has helped the U.S. labor market.

item.title: Ajit Jain, Buffett's insurance leader for nearly 40 years, dumps more than half of Berkshire stake
item.description: The 73-year-old vice chairman of insurance operations sold 200 Berkshire Class A shares on Monday for roughly $139 million.

item.title: Moderna shares plunge on plans to cut $1.1 billion in costs, launch 10 new products by 2027
item.description: Moderna is deprioritizing certain parts of its pipeline, which involves pausing work on some products and scrapping others.

item.title: Microsoft hires former GE CFO Carolina Dybeck Happe as new operating chief
item.description: Carolina Dybeck Happe is joining Microsoft's top leadership ranks after helping GE to bring its aviation and energy businesses public.

item.title: Wholesale prices rose 0.2% in August, in line with expectations
item.description: The producer price index was expected to increase 0.2% in August, according to the Dow Jones consensus forecast.

item.title: Judge tosses two criminal counts against Trump, keeps top charge in Georgia election case
item.description: Former President Donald Trump is continuing to challenge a ruling in his Georgia election interference case to disqualify District Attorney Fani Willis.

item.title: Airbus Ventures launches $155 million fund focused on deep tech, including space
item.description: Airbus Ventures, one of the most prolific investors in space startups, raised a $155 million fund.

item.title: Navient reaches $120 million settlement with CFPB for misleading student loan borrowers
item.description: The CFPB sued Navient in 2017 for misleading borrowers and providing them with bad information.

item.title: SpaceX performs historic first spacewalk with Polaris Dawn crew
item.description: SpaceX pulled off its first spacewalk in the early hours of Thursday morning, in a historic first for a company.

item.title: Bill Gates-backed startup says a global gold rush for buried hydrogen is picking up momentum
item.description: Geologic hydrogen — sometimes known as white, gold or natural hydrogen — refers to hydrogen gas that is found in its natural form beneath Earth's surface.

item.title: GM and Hyundai agree to explore collaboration on vehicles and manufacturing to reduce capital spending
item.description: Potential areas of interest include production of passenger and commercial vehicles, internal combustion engines and electric and hydrogen technologies.

item.title: Tokyo says it 'lodged a protest' after North Korea fired missiles toward Sea of Japan
item.description: The launch came days after Kim Jong Un vowed to increase the country's nuclear capabilities.

item.title: China wants to challenge the U.S. in AI — here's what Chinese giants are doing with the tech
item.description: China's ambitions to become a world leader in AI technology adds another layer to the technology battle between it and the U.S.

item.title: Trump Media shares sink to new post-merger low after presidential debate
item.description: Republican nominee Donald Trump is the majority owner of Trump Media, which operates the social media platform Truth Social and trades as DJT on the Nasdaq.
